page.title: 06THE PEOPLE OF BURTON PIDSEA
page.content: MR WRAY Mr. Wray came into the school to tell us about the village and the school and the ways in which they have changed. He has lived in the village all his life and his family have been here for generations. He is well known in the village for his local knowledge and he has a huge collection of photographs which he has taken, or has had given to him, over the years. Mr. Wray was the Parish Clerk for forty years. He only went to the village school until he was eleven years old because his family was one of the few that could afford to send their children to the Grammar School in Hull. Mr. Wray knew everyone in the village at one time but now there are so many more people living here.
